content.1: Blessed be the LORD my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:
content.2: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.
content.4: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.
content.5: Bow thy heavens, O LORD , and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
content.6: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.
content.7: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;
content.8: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
content.9: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.
content.11: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:
content.12: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:
content.15: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea , happy is that people, whose God is the LORD .
